description: {"blocks":[{"key":"17i73","text":"The method covers how soil cores were received and depth stratified. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"ci4le","text":"Site Cores (Cores A, B, C1-4)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkcj6","text":"Core Extruder (Long stick with flask disk on end by broom in 1446)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8aen","text":"Aluminum Foil","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37med","text":"70% ethanol","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qbrj","text":"Kimwipes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9eb5","text":"Gloves","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g084","text":"Bench Scraper","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39q07","text":"Ruler/Measuring tape in cm","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9muib","text":"Sharpies/writing utensils ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jmv9","text":"4mm sieves and base","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q45h","text":"Processing kit (Box with tubes, bags, tins, and labels)
    50 mL conical tubes (for both top and bottom)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"okvv","text":"                1 pH","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dem7","text":"                1 P - extraction
                6 N (3 for extraction and 3 for extractant)
                9 for microbial biomass (3 MicB, 3 MicB_Back, 3 MicB_Fum; only MicB gets filled with soil)
                6 unlabeled 50 ml tubes for P extract (will get labeled following pH measurements)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7c0f8","text":"        Whirlpak bags","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8f7hq","text":"                DNA (Top and Bottom)
                Removed rock and roots (Top, Middle, and Bottom)
                Large aluminum pans (4 total for Top (2), Middle, Bottom; Extras are stored in 1106 if needed)
        Small aluminum weigh boats
                GWC – 3 each for top and bottom","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eevsd","text":"When cores are received first check that there are cores labeled Core A, Core B, and Cores C1-4 included in the sample cooler. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ah6ec","text":"Place Core A and C4 back into the site bag and store vertically in the  refrigerator in 1446.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":70,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f27eg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1CC508C045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93ttg","text":"Spray down the table with a 70% EtOH solution and wipe down using kimwipes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2qbq2","text":"Wearing gloves, tear two large sections of foil (~2.5 ft in length) and place them overlapping by half onto the cleaned tabletop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5p43s","text":"Using a permanent marker write the site code at one end of the foil. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pc3f","text":"Lay the Core B core on the foil horizontally and remove the caps (top and bottom) noting which section of the core is top on the foil. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3mor","text":"Clean the core extruding tool with 70% EtOH, align the flat end of the extruder with the bottom exposed soil.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9p331","text":"While maintaining a horizonal position on the bench slide the tube up the core extruders handle to release the core onto the foil. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4m3ga","text":"Take photographs of the soil core with and without a measuring tape making sure to include the site label in the photos.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1a6hk","text":"Record the cores total length and how well it maintained the shape of the tube in the core processing files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kqfs","text":"In the Processing file record the core receiving and splitting information.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6t34e","text":"Using a bench scraper and a measuring tape slice the core at 10 cm from the top and 10 cm from the bottom. Record the depth range for each section on the processing forms. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1282t","text":"Using 70% EtOH wipe out clean (rinsed with water) 4 mm sieve. Stacking the sieve on top of the lower pan scrape each section (top, middle, and bottom) into its own clean and labeled sieve. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4u38i","text":"Gently shake and stir (with a clean sterilized gloved hand) the soil in the sieve being careful not to force soil through sieve. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9pb9q","text":"Once sieving is completed collect all items remaining on the sieve into a whirlpak bag labeled with the site code, removed, and depth fraction for example (1000S_PRS1_Removed_ TOP). Record the mass of the bag and the total mass (bag + removed rocks/roots) on the corresponding section of the Processing file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3c1ne","text":"To measure gravimetric water content (GWC) on the top and bottom core sections record the mass of the empty tin and the mass of the tin +   of soil. Place the tins in the   degree oven for   to   or a   degree oven for  . GWC is collected in triplicate and make sure the tins are labelled with the 1000S_SITE_GWC_DEPTH_1-3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":138,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":171,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":189,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":194,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":201,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":219,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e1bi7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"44B1D43045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"46FF46A045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"60","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":172800,"guid":"6033C29045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":259200,"guid":"69E60F5045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"4":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"4A4B646045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"100","unit":10}},"5":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"6FEBA7C045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4p9jm","text":"Collect a minimum of   of soil for DNA into a whirlpak bag for the top and bottom sections. These samples will be labelled with the site code, DNA, and depth fraction (Top and Bottom). For example: 1000S_PRS1_DNA_Top","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"rqta","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"4FF632A045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9od5k","text":"Collect  (within  ) of soil for pH into a   falcon tube for the top and bottom sections. The samples should be labelled with the site code, pH, and depth fraction. For example: 1000S_PRS1_pH_Top.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":17,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":42,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4ppc4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"7C43E73045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.1","error":false,"guid":"7EE2ADF045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"813A599045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eue59","text":"Collect ~  of soil for phosphorus extraction into a   falcon tube for the top and bottom sections. The samples should be labelled with the site code, P, and depth fraction. For example: PROS_P_Top.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":52,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1sc6r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"12","error":false,"guid":"8502AC3045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"87B3C27045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ffoq","text":"To measure microbial biomass and N extractions place exactly   (within  ) of soil into six   falcon tubes for the top and bottom sections. Record the mass onto the MicrobialBiomass_N tab. The 6 tubes will be labelled with three for microbial biomass and three for N extraction. For example: PRS1_N_Top_1-3 \u0026 PRS1_MicB_TOP_1-3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":71,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":91,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"86ehf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"8","error":false,"guid":"8CC7CEF045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.02","error":false,"guid":"8ECE9B7045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"90EF589045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ssjg","text":"The remaining sieved soil will be placed in a labelled clean aluminum pie pan and covered with foil and stored at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":114,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6cssq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"95DE77F045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23mrl","text":"Repeat the sieving and subsampling steps for the bottom section and sieve and store the middle section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1atb7","text":"Store samples in the appropriate location:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cubj6","text":"Keep each core, if processing multiple simultaneously, in its own dedicated area/table.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eaa8r","text":"Processing_Template *actual template","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":19}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FAA319D145B311ED821B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pnnl.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/EMSL/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B56efc146-bb8f-44c7-b855-46977636d065%7D\u0026action=default\u0026uid=%7B56EFC146-BB8F-44C7-B855-46977636D065%7D\u0026ListItemId=17198\u0026ListId=%7BDF1A08C3-14DA-4669-A81B-4822034D70C2%7D\u0026odsp=1\u0026env=prod"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4lf80","text":"Make sure to save the Processing_Template document with the site codes for example: “Processing_PRS1_PRS2.xlsx”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ig8a","text":"In only the top 10 cm section add cores C1-3 during sieving to homogenize. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b2uev","text":"Do not combine the top middle and bottom sections at any point.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"768i3","text":"If the soils have a high clay content you may need to use a sterilized paint brush to break up the particles using a stippling motion (vertical tapping).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8hvo2","text":"Break up large aggregates between fingers and continue sieving. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ee0fd","text":"Do not tare out the whirlpak prior to adding soil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8d1eh","text":"Make sure to record the wet mass and dry mass (after  or  ) in the processing file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":57,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"70p34","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"73C670F045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":172800,"guid":"77A1131045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e376v","text":"Following pH samples with a pH less than 7 will be extracted using the Bray Method, while samples with pH greater than 7 will be extracted using the Olsen Method. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"equar","text":"Soils are air dried in the BSC hood in 1521. Depending on the mineral composition soils can take longer to air dry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2b98","text":"Book time for the BSC hood using this calendar:  1521 BSC Hood Calendar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":49,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":22}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7CBA091945B511ED821B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://confluence.pnnl.gov/confluence/calendar/calendarPage.action?spaceKey=OMICS\u0026calendarId=680e251d-601c-4e06-995f-a14b2f85ed59"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3sspk","text":"Reminder Core A and Core C4 are not processed at this time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3q0rn","text":"Store the DNA samples in a zip-top bag labelled 1000 soils and in the .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ai1d5","text":"                These samples are typically on the middle shelf of the furthest east   in the corridor behind 1521.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4qt7h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"9C0C58E045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A0B2615045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4lu00","text":"Refrigerate the pH and P extraction samples until done processing cores. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"915um","text":"Place GWC tins in the drying oven in 1446 at 60C for   to  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":58,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b7f9g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":172800,"guid":"A559A24045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":259200,"guid":"AD590EE045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fj19h","text":"Dry the remaining soils in the BSC hood for   to   or until dry. After soils are dry collect a  Olympus centrifuge tube of OM analysis and seal the remainder in labeled Polypropylene jars for archive. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":49,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":95,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5044b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":172800,"guid":"B87E73A045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":259200,"guid":"BB5CB46045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"C04D817045B711ED9EC129B0F51944DF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

title: Core Receiving and Splitting
